I played Days of Defeat: Source for the first time in 2021 and was surprised. A fun first-person shooter with a tight-knit and active community of 50-150 people, give or take.

I'd give this game a try if you get it on sale or already have the game from purchasing the Valve complete pack.

This game is actually really fun, surprisingly so in fact. 

I wish Valve would make a new one.

Basically WW2 counter strike with a mix of TF2. It's actually a pretty decent game if you manage to find a server that isn't some crappy modded gun game server, or a server that doesn't have bullshit rules with 30 year old tryhards playing the game like if their life depends on it.

Day Of Defeat: Source review
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Pros:
+FPS
+Day Of Defeat but with much better graphics also the Source engine
+Community servers and maps
+Balanced classes
+Same feel to the guns as in original Day Of Defeat
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Cons:
-Its hard to get used to the guns
-Easy to spawn kill
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
Do I recommend Day Of Defeat: Source?
Yes

Yeah, it's a fun game, that's all I can say about it
The servers are surprisingly full which was unexpected, I guess Valve knew what they were doing when they made this game.
The game can be ran on anything, you don't need a computer worth thousands.
It's fun, there is a pretty good selection of maps and classes, and I'm sure if you brought in some friends it'd be even more amusing.
The price is just right, not too expensive.
The graphics are a bit, eh. Not the best.
Also, it was weird when I was standing still and guns were not 100% accurate, but I guess it adds to the realism.
